most_active_tickets.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
Failed sharing my snippets using a link or GitHub gist.
Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
LTM gets gunged up over time
Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS leads to null.pieces.cloud
I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues Across Multiple Clients
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting various clients (VS Code, Desktop app, Chrome/Edge extensions) to Pieces OS.  Common symptoms include connection hangs, leaks, and inability to register tools.  Suggested solutions include checking Pieces OS and client configurations, restarting Pieces OS or the client, verifying network connectivity (especially VPN for browser extensions), and monitoring connections for leaks.  The Pieces Desktop app may be a source of connection leaks.

related_issues.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
related_issues.text:
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Pieces MCP server fails to properly integrate with Claude Code within VSCode. While the SSE endpoint responds initially, it hangs indefinitely, preventing MCP tools from being registered or used. This affects Claude Code integration both as a standalone CLI and when used within VS Code.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install Pieces OS and Pieces app
2. Login in the app
3. Configure MCP in Claude Code's ~/.claude.json:

```json
{
  "pieces": {
    "type": "sse",
    "url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse"
}
```

4. Attempt to use Pieces MCP tools (e.g., mcp__pieces__ask_pieces_ltm) in Claude Code
5. Tools are not available despite server being configured
6. Same issue occurs whether using Claude Code in terminal or integrated with VS Code

**Technical Details:**
- SSE endpoint (http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse) responds with:

```
event: endpoint
data: /model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages
```

- Connection then hangs indefinitely (SSE buffering issue)
- Both Pieces OS and Pieces app processes are running
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and related software connectivity and sharing issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties with Pieces OS and related software (Desktop App, browser extensions) across Windows. Issues include personal domain names reverting to null.pieces.cloud, browser extensions failing to connect to Pieces OS, and inability to share snippets via links or GitHub gists.  The Pieces OS version is 12.1.1 and Desktop App version 4.3.1 in reported cases. Connectivity problems may be related to VPN usage.

related_issues.title: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS leads to null.pieces.cloud
related_issues.text: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS leads to null.pieces.cloud ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hi, If I edit the username of my personal domain, it takes a couple of minutes before it's named "null.pieces.cloud." It doesn't matter whether the username contains only letters or a combination of letters and numbers. No spaces or uppercase letters are used. I'm using the Desktop App Version 4.3.1 Regards Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues across Desktop and Web extensions
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing connection issues with Pieces OS across different platforms, including Desktop and Web extensions.  The Desktop app exhibits a connection leak, creating excessive connections to the OS server. Web extensions, specifically Chrome and Edge, are unable to connect to Pieces OS even with VPN configurations.  Potential solutions include closing the Desktop app to resolve leaks, monitoring connections, restarting the OS server, and checking VPN and proxy settings for web extensions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces Pro Features Unavailable Despite Upgrade
common_issues.description: Users report being unable to access Pieces Pro features after upgrading, encountering errors about needing Pro despite being subscribed. Issues appear across desktop app, VS Code, Sublime plugins, and web extensions.  Problems include LLM not upgrading to latest version (stuck on older versions like Sonnet 3.5) and inability to connect to Pieces OS, especially for users in regions requiring VPNs.  Suggested solutions include checking configuration files, restarting, re-login, and verifying VPN/proxy settings.

related_issues.title: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
related_issues.text: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Visual Studio, Sublime Plugin, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows 11 ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have a small problem now that cannot be solved through LLM: - I have inquired with LLM in **pieces for developers** and **pieces vscode plugin**, and they all said they are Sonnet 3.5. - The pieces LLM in sublime (set claude 3.7 sonnet) keeps silence about this: **Copilot**: I'm an AI assistant created by Anthropic named Claude, and my training data has a cutoff date. While I don't typically specify my exact version details, I can tell you that my knowledge cutoff is around late 2023. This means I don't have information about events, technologies, or developments that occurred after that time. However, - I just **upgraded to Pieces Pro yesterday** and have switched to Sonnet 4 (for all pieces IDE plugins and Desktop Apps, except for sublime which only support sonnet 3.7 till now). - Every test chat was opened in a new Chat after the LLM is switched( to Sonnet 4 or Gemini 2.5 Pro)... - I've checked the configuration files and they are all Sonnet 4 without any issues. - I have tried restarting my computer or logging in to my account again, but still have this bug - I have tried changing my computer and VPN node, including canceling or adding the global system proxy, but none of them worked PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. ## Pieces for Deveopers (desktop app) ## Vscode plugin ## Sublime plugin Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
related_issues.text:
I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using Pieces I asked, "what did I work today?" and I received an error that says `I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.`  When I have paid for pro and am signed in. What I expect is that I can use my paid pro membership to run query and not receive an error.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/846a4e3e-9e24-4e51-81ce-061a22e921ec)

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues Across Desktop and Web Extensions
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting to Pieces OS from both desktop and web extensions.  Sharing snippets via links or GitHub gists is failing.  The web extensions, even with VPN configurations, cannot connect.  This affects Windows users and may be related to VPN usage or network configurations.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS and its various clients (Desktop app, VS Code, browser extensions). Investigate connection leaks and ensure compatibility with different network configurations, including VPNs.
Address the problem of Pieces Pro features being unavailable despite users upgrading. Verify proper propagation of Pro status and LLM version updates.
Improve communication regarding personal domain setup in Pieces OS to prevent users from encountering the "null.pieces.cloud" issue.
Investigate and resolve issues with sharing snippets via links and GitHub gists.
Review and update documentation and support resources to address common connectivity problems and Pro upgrade issues.
